title: Minerva Style Guide
text:
When creating content:

Use standard Quarto markdown
Use callouts for highlighted content
Use proper heading hierarchy (H1 â†’ H2 â†’ H3)
Keep paragraphs short (3-5 sentences)
Test on mobile viewport
Avoid inline styles â€” use existing classes
Check math renders at all sizes

title: Minerva Style Guide
text:
Donâ€™t: - Add inline CSS to .qmd files - Create custom colors outside the palette - Use <font> or other deprecated HTML - Mix heading levels (e.g., H1 â†’ H3) - Create ultra-wide content that breaks layout
Do: - Use semantic HTML and Quarto classes - Let the theme handle styling - Use callouts for emphasis - Keep content width within bounds

title: Deployment Guide
text:
How to deploy Minerva to GitHub Pages.




A GitHub account
Git installed locally
Quarto v1.3+ installed
The site builds successfully with quarto render





This method renders locally and pushes to GitHub.



Go to github.com/new
Repository name: minerva (or your preferred name)
Description: â€œFaroese Mathematics Educationâ€
Visibility: Public (required for free GitHub Pages)
Do NOT initialize with README, .gitignore, or license
Click Create repository




Open terminal in your project folder:
# Initialize git repository
git init

# Add all files
git add .

# Create initial commit
git commit -m "Initial commit: Minerva Quarto site"



Replace YOUR_USERNAME and REPO_NAME with your values:
# Add remote origin
git remote add origin https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/REPO_NAME.git

# Push to GitHub
git branch -M main
git push -u origin main




Go to your repository on GitHub
Click Settings â†’ Pages (left sidebar)
Under â€œSourceâ€, select:

Branch: main
Folder: /docs

Click Save
Wait 2-3 minutes for deployment




Your site will be available at:
https://YOUR_USERNAME.github.io/REPO_NAME/





After making changes:
# 1. Render the site
quarto render

# 2. Stage changes
git add .

# 3. Commit
git commit -m "Description of changes"

# 4. Push
git push
GitHub Pages will automatically update within a few minutes.




This method builds automatically when you push.


The file .github/workflows/quarto-publish.yml should contain:
name: Quarto Publish

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  build-deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: write
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
      - uses: quarto-dev/quarto-actions/setup@v2
      
      - name: Render Quarto Project
        run: quarto render
        
      - name: Deploy to GitHub Pages
        uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v3
        with:
          github_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          publish_dir: ./docs




Go to repository Settings â†’ Actions â†’ General
Under â€œWorkflow permissionsâ€, select Read and write permissions
Click Save





Go to Settings â†’ Pages
Under â€œSourceâ€, select:

Branch: gh-pages (created by Actions)
Folder: / (root)

Click Save

Now the site rebuilds automatically on every push!








Wait a few minutes for GitHub Pages to deploy
Check that Settings â†’ Pages shows correct branch/folder
Verify docs/ folder was pushed to GitHub
Check _quarto.yml has output-dir: docs





Ensure site-url in _quarto.yml matches your GitHub Pages URL
Clear browser cache (Ctrl+Shift+R)
Re-render with quarto render





Check the Actions tab for error logs
Common issues:

Missing Quarto files
Syntax errors in .qmd files
Invalid YAML in _quarto.yml






Force push: git push --force
Check Actions tab for workflow status
Verify files changed in docs/ folder






quarto_3/
â”œâ”€â”€ _quarto.yml          # Must have output-dir: docs
â”œâ”€â”€ docs/                # Built site (pushed to GitHub)
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ index.html
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ search.json
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ ...
â””â”€â”€ .github/
    â””â”€â”€ workflows/
        â””â”€â”€ quarto-publish.yml  # (Optional) Auto-build





Quarto: Publishing to GitHub Pages
GitHub Pages Documentation
GitHub Actions for Quarto






Repository created on GitHub
Local git initialized and connected
Site rendered with quarto render
All files committed and pushed
GitHub Pages enabled in Settings
Site loads at GitHub Pages URL
Styles and math display correctly

text:

Upphav
Vit vilja finna eitt fast gjald \(y\), sum skal betalast hvÃ¸nn termin Ã­ \(n\) terminar, so at eitt lÃ¡n \(L\) viÃ° rentu \(r\) verÃ°ur gjaldaÃ° av.


NÃºtÃ­Ã°arvirÃ°i av gjÃ¸ldum
NÃºtÃ­Ã°arvirÃ°iÃ° av Ã¸llum terminsgjÃ¸ldum skal vera lÃ­ka mikiÃ° sum lÃ¡nsupphÃ¦ddin:
\[

\]


Geometrisk rÃ¸Ã°
Hetta er ein geometrisk rÃ¸Ã° viÃ° fyrsta limi \(y \cdot (1+r)^{-1}\) og kvotan \((1+r)^{-1}\).
Summan av geometriskari rÃ¸Ã° er:
\[

\]


Einfalding
\[

\]
\[
L = y \cdot \frac{1 - (1+r)^{-n}}{r}
\]

\[
